skill.name: synthese-multi-llm
skill.description: Synthèse co-fabriquée par un conseil de 3 LLMs (Claude, Gemini, Codex). Ce skill devrait être utilisé quand l'utilisateur demande une synthèse robuste, traçable et vérifiée. Il orchestre trois modèles avec des rôles experts distincts (Extracteur, Critique, Architecte) pour produire une synthèse fidèle au texte source, avec contrôle des glissements sémantiques et trail d'audit complet.
skill.summary: Synthèse co-fabriquée par un conseil de 3 LLMs (Claude, Gemini, Codex). Ce skill devrait être utilis...
skill.author: Alexmacapple

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate multi-LLM orchestration tool for text summarization. The static analyzer's 588 findings are overwhelmingly false positives. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings are markdown documentation being misidentified. 'Shell backtick execution' findings are markdown code formatting. 'API/secret keys' findings are proper environment variable access patterns. The critical heuristics are triggered by legitimate subprocess execution for CLI model calls and API interactions with proper credential handling. No evidence of malicious intent, data exfiltration, or harmful patterns found.

content.user_title: Generate robust summaries with multi-LLM council
content.value_statement: Get reliable, verified summaries by having Claude, Gemini, and Codex analyze your text from different perspectives. The council detects semantic shifts and measures agreement to ensure accuracy.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates 3 LLMs with distinct expert roles for balanced analysis
Detects semantic shifts and measures convergence between models
Generates complete audit trails of the synthesis process
Works with 1-3 models depending on availability
limitations: Requires at least one CLI or API key to function
Processing time increases with number of models used
Quality depends on source text clarity and proper framing

use_cases.title: Create verified summaries
use_cases.description: Generate reliable summaries of reports, articles, or documents with built-in verification

use_cases.title: Validate understanding
use_cases.description: Check your interpretation of complex texts against multiple AI perspectives

use_cases.title: Improve document quality
use_cases.description: Produce consistent summaries adapted to different audiences and purposes

prompt_templates.title: Quick summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Synthétise ce texte avec le conseil en 5 lignes

prompt_templates.title: Formal report
prompt_templates.prompt: Crée une synthèse formelle de ce rapport pour le comité de direction

prompt_templates.title: Critical review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyse cette synthèse et vérifie si des glissements sémantiques sont présents

prompt_templates.title: Multi-source
prompt_templates.prompt: Fais une synthèse complète avec le conseil en mode pédagogique

output_examples.input: Synthétise cet article sur les énergies renouvelables
output: Points clés identifiés : transition énergétique, solaire, éolien
Points de vigilance signalés : coût initial des infrastructures

output_examples.input: Vérifie cette synthèse d'un rapport financier
output: Analyse critique : aucun glissement sémantique détecté
Faits principaux préservés : revenus +15%, pertes réduites
Recommandation : synthèse valide et fidèle au source

best_practices: Provide clear framing parameters (recipient, purpose, length) for better results
Check convergence scores below 70% for potential interpretation issues
Review audit trails when accuracy is critical
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts without framing loses the council advantage
Ignoring low convergence scores can lead to unreliable summaries
Skipping the audit trail defeats traceability benefits

faq.question: What models are supported?
faq.answer: Claude CLI, Gemini CLI, and Codex CLI are supported. Works with any available combination from 1 to 3 models.

faq.question: How does the council process work?
faq.answer: Three rounds: extraction, cross-critique, and final synthesis. Each model contributes a unique perspective.

faq.question: What is convergence score?
faq.answer: A percentage (0-100%) measuring agreement between experts. Above 90% means strong consensus, below 50% signals major disagreements.

faq.question: Are API keys required?
faq.answer: API keys are needed only for direct API backends. CLI-based usage works with standard CLI authentication.

faq.question: What does the audit trail contain?
faq.answer: Full JSON record including source text, parameters, all expert responses, convergence scores, and final synthesis.

faq.question: Can I use fewer than 3 models?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill adapts to available models. One model skips critique, two models have limited convergence checking.
